result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby Lee Dickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Case adjourned to 06-01-2015 at 10:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Restitution Hearing.

**07-17-15/Rest. Hearing**
Upon stipulation of the parties, Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
Defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges, defendant to provide DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge within 90 days of release. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
With release privileges for employment and treatment purposes only. Credit for 98 days time served.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby Lee Dickson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant asking court to send him to a halfway house so he can look for work.

Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a restitution hearing.
The parties have reached an agreement.

Upon stipulation of the parties, Court MODIFIED the judgment of conviction and ordered restitution set at ZERO.

Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties not ready to proceed with a Restitution Hearing today.
Case adjourned to 07-17-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Restitution Hearing.

Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION with release privileges for employment and treatment purposes only. Credit for 98 days time served.

COURT ORDERS:
- Defendant to provide DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge within 90 days of release.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges within 90 days of release.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution to be determined at an upcoming Restitution Hearing.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Case adjourned to 06-01-2015 at 10:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Restitution Hearing.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Crime Victim Impact Statement with attached Restitution Worksheet.
(1) Character Witness Letter.

Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in custody.  Intern Lindsey Anderson appears under Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 2.
As to the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Defendant remanded pending sentencing in Branch 2 on 5-7-2015 at 1:30pm

Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel in court, defendant Bobby Lee Dickson not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 04-20-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
**Court CANCELLED the 05-06-2015 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel in court, defendant Bobby Lee Dickson not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt for Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Scheduling Conference held.
**Defense enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 05-06-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 05-06-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
Speedy trial demand.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in custody.  Ron Dague for Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Dominique Heaggen-Brown/MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in custody.  Ron Dague for Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel did not appear this a.m., thought this case was scheduled on the afternoon calendar.  State did have an officer present for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Bail to be addressed on the next court appearance.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Levdrice S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  
Defendant Bobby Lee Dickson in custody.  
William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
